title: Coincidental almost intentional lag spikes?
body:
Greetings, I've been pretty tilted and stressed out to a random disconnecting situation in league.

In draft games/etc, I've recently started to encounter literally unplayable lag spikes during a certain point in time as it was almost intentional.
For example, a team fight or just a fight I generally am confident to win, but this latency literally destroys all of it and smashes it into pieces which makes the game completely unfair and unplayable for me.

 I cannot do anything with this, I am not sure how to fix it. My internet works completely perfectly smooth and fine, this has never occurred to me, other than league itself. The game disconnects, everything stops, people sometimes slide around, but I remain there slamming things and everything out of frustration and knowing that I'm just going to die anyways, this is a mega big screw you right into my face. It hurts.

I have not found any solutions or any topic related to this, as most of them are just general latency occurrences, if anyone has any idea/suggestions please please please do! I'm really fed up with this latency issue and it's been super frustrating to me!

And for some reason if I select a different type of champion it rarely lags. I feel like I'm being targeted. ;/


--- ... ---

Hey anyways, thanks for taking your time checking this discussion out. I really need a solution for this.
I do not want to start ranked like this. And a really massive appreciation if you manage to find a solution for this. 
I really cannot wait, until I return to playing League Of Legends properly as I was before.

▬ CONTROIIER ▬

replies.body: I would be pretty tilted too, especially in the middle of a team fight.  I'd like to help!  It sounds like you might be experiencing packet loss or enough network instability that it's cutting you from the game server.  Even though your internet seems fine you can still run into blocks reaching specific services.  When you get a chance, run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) on those impacted games so we can get an overview of your case.

I did and checked out the link for my network issues.

https://gyazo.com/00f5c4c42e1c4b07571f44ada93db459 - Image of the Packet Loss graph

This looks pretty unstable, is it? I am not really too sure.

Holy cow that is a lot of packet loss!  That looks really unstable.  ><  Are you running on wifi by chance, and tried [power cycling ](https://kb.netgear.com/19755/How-to-Power-Cycle-Your-Home-Network?cid=wmt_netgear_organic)your router yet?

I mainly use Ethernet connection, because Wireless isn't really strong around the parts.
I might have to contact my ISP, and check out whats the problem. As far as I know this only occurs in League Of Legends, so I am not entirely sure to contact them. However there are numerous possibilities of this issue.

No worries, let's break it down with a traceroute!  Download [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and run a route to the game server: 104.160.131.1.  Run it for about 5 minutes, replace the IP address with dashes on the first two rows only, and let me know what you find.

My hunch tells me that results will pinpoint a local or router issue, but it's good to know for sure.  Let me know!

Here are the status of the connectivity through the server routes.

https://gyazo.com/0ba7e58d91ea413b5fce855636346301 - WinMTR Stats

Any hits?

Thanks for the logs!  Yeah, it looks like the issue might be specific to your ISP.   The first line is missing, but it looks like you start getting packet loss right away.  See if configuring your DNS per this [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide can help.

If you run another traceroute to google.com and get packet loss, it's a safe bet that your ISP might be having issues getting you around.

Go to cmd, do an ipconfig to find your default gateway ip address, then in a new line type: ping (your default gateway ip for your router), see if you have any packet loss. If it shows 1ms all the way through with 0 loss your connection between your PC, network and router is fine.

I have noticed and have had players in game using lag switches, some say there can never be a lag switch in LoL. But there is and has been, I have been playing games long enough to know what one is and how they use them. Aside from the DDOS attacks even on the best players in the game at that time, which they can easily check on op.gg which I have had done on myself as well, right down to hacking my LoL account last week while I was in game, which I caught and traced the IP back to EU. 

This is a theory, but I get the feeling there are some exploits developed for this game Riot has no idea even exist. And many will say the hell with that, and that is ok because only a fool would think that. In the computer world almost anything is possible. So aside from what Riot already knows about such as the lag switches, dodge, auto, ummm ward and map exploits, zoom-hack, aim-bots for the skill shot champ,  lag switches of course, EX/LP exploits I could go on. These exploits are still in the game I encounter them still often. And or just boosting and the worst one bots, some still running from years ago from what I found on line in the hacking forums. I don't use these by the way, just research to develop my anti cheat for games coming out in the next couple years. 

But I also feel ones that don't get sold online and stay on the black market, a couple tools that help the hacker see who the other team is selecting for champs in champ select, and another that allows players to dodge Q's, and dodge Q's until they get either their bot or feed account on the apposing team, and or 4 of them in game together on the ranked solo/duo Q. This is just a theory of mine at this stage, but I am researching. I have my degree in Network Security, and Admin/Forensic which I finished year before last, since then it kind of opened my mind to the possibility's of exploiting in the PC world and games. 

I have a couple other theory's as well which I am researching for Riot which I will keep to myself until i have proof or enough evidence. But given the games coding, and server set up's it is not hard to exploit in this game and develop programs that can work around the games boundaries with our Riot knowing. 

So if you think you are being targeted sometimes in game, you could be. 

But first start ruling out all other options, repair the client? See if the problem continues? Uninstall the game and delete all files and folders of from the previous installation from your program files as well, taking LoL right off your PC. Then reinstall the game see if the problem continues? 

Have you checked your Video card and short term memory (Ram) for errors or any needed updates on your Video audio? Is your video card old? Do you have enough ram? Also if your power supply is not powerful enough for all the components, the performance will be dramatically negatively affected. It won't work, or it might work for simple things, then fail when your graphics card powers up to run a game or graphically intense application.

Is your PC dusty? That one you would be surprised about, many do not blow the dust off of their components in their PC tower or Laptop?

Change your passwords, encrypt them as well. 


~J

I'll see what I can do about it, I'll try to be more aware of my games and be vigilante around League.

And no, I don't think my Graphics card is outdated, nor that if I have enough ram. It is possible it could be a malware or a virus affecting something, but the recent scan and search I received back was no threats. So I'm still around the gray areas of this issue.

Thank you for the wonderful suggestion, it really does sound pretty intriguing and something to be fully aware, much appreciation!
